data.text:
Want your wedding ceremony to go without a hitch?! Read on for some essential tips which will ensure it‚Äôs seamless: 1. Bridal party: leave plenty of time for you all to get into your dresses (aim to start at least an hour before your ceremony time) to avoid any last minute rushing and to allow for final tweaks to hair, veil and accessories. This is especially true if you are having a Church or registrar led ceremony as they work to strict schedules! 2. Traditionally, grooms face forward as the bride enters. However, feel free to steal a glance if you can‚Äôt resist! Some guests enjoy watching the groom‚Äôs reaction, but don‚Äôt worry if you don‚Äôt shed a tear ‚Äì it‚Äôs not obligatory. If you do get emotional, have a handkerchief handy (This insight comes from personal experience, as my husband and I both needed one!) 3. Brides, remember to walk down the aisle slower than you think ‚Äì savour the moment and give your photographer and videographer ample time to capture every detail. The same applies to bridesmaids; ensure they maintain a suitable distance between each other 4. Carry your bouquet at waist height with the flowers facing outward 5. Prior to the ceremony, ask your registrar/celebrant/vicar to step aside for your first kiss for it to be beautifully captured 6. Walk back down the aisle as a married couple at a relaxed pace, allowing your guests to shower you with confetti (thrown upwards, not towards you!). Perhaps pause midway for another kiss ‚Äì it could result in a stunning photo. If all of this feels overwhelming, consider hiring a planner to ensure everything goes smoothly - we can also make sure your dress train looks perfect as you take those first steps! Save this reel for future reference üñ§ . . . Wedding day photography can be hectic if you do not have the poses planned out. Here are a few essential pictures that you need to take on your big day üì∑ The "First Look": Capture the moment your partner sees you for the first time in your wedding attire. üì∑ Ceremony Kiss: Freeze the moment as you share your first kiss as newlyweds. üì∑ Bridal Party: Gather with your bridesmaids for a fun and candid photo to celebrate your friendship. üì∑ Family Portraits: Take formal portraits with your family members to commemorate the special day. üì∑ Reception Entrance: Document the excitement as you and your partner make your grand entrance to the reception. üì∑ Sunset/Sunrise Shot: Capture a romantic photo during golden hour to cherish the beauty of your wedding day. These timeless snapshots will help you relive the magic of your wedding day for years to come. Do you have any specific pose in mind? Share with me in the comments below. #Weddingplanning101 #weddingimages #weddingdayphotography

‚ú® Capture the Magic Before "I Do!" ‚ú® Your wedding day is more than just the ceremony‚Äîit's a journey filled with anticipation, joy, and special moments that deserve to be remembered. That's why we have a package specifically for *wedding preparation pictures* to add to your wedding day photography package. üì∏ Why Include Preparation Photos? üü¢Unscripted Moments: The candid emotions, the laughter with your bridal party, and those quiet, reflective moments are all part of your story. üü¢Details Matter: From the delicate lace on your dress to the final touches of your makeup, these details tell a unique story of your day. üü¢Building the Narrative: These photos help create a full, beautiful narrative of your wedding day, from the first glance in the mirror to the moment you walk down the aisle. Let us help you capture these priceless memories so you can relive every moment, every smile, and every tear of joy. üíç Ready to start your forever?
